GapFillInput.Title: Superlative adjectives
GapFillInput.Instruction: Type a superlative from the word pool into each gap.

Content.Question:
1. The highest waterfall in the world is the Angel Falls in Venezuala. It is 979 metres.
2. The most expensive jam in the world is ‘Confiture de Groselles’ from France. It costs $70 for one jar.
3. The biggest coin ever was from Alaska in 1850. It was 100 cm * 50 cm and weighed 40 kg.
4. Beauty and the Beast was the first film to win the best picture Oscar for a cartoon.
5. The shortest plane flight in the world is from Westray to Papa Westray near Scotland. It takes only two minutes.
6. The world’s most popular fruit is the banana.
7. The oldest person ever was Shigechiyo Izumi from Japan. He was 120.
8. Larissa Latynina from Russia was the most successful sportswoman at the Olympic Games. She won
18 medals from 1956 to 1964.
9. The longest war in England was the 100 years war. It took 116 years.
10. Dutch men are the tallest in the world at 1.78 metres on average.
